subject: Using MockResultSet
msgSnippet: Hi, I have a problem I am using a mock Resultset and initialising it as follows String sql = SELECT * FROM CUSTOMER ;
messageBody:
Hi,
I have a problem
I am using a mock Resultset and initialising it as follows
String sql = "SELECT * FROM CUSTOMER";

connection1.setupAddPreparedStatement(sql,statement);
String[] columnsUppercase = new String[]
{"FIRSTNAME",
"LASTNAME"};
String[] columnsLowercase = new String[]
{"firstname",
"lastname"};
String[] columnClasseNames = new String[] {
String.class.getName(),
String.class.getName()};


resultSetMetaData.setupAddColumnNames(columnsUppercase);

resultSetMetaData.setupAddColumnClassNames(
columnClasseNames);
resultSetMetaData.setupGetColumnCount(2);

resultSet.addExpectedIndexedValues(new Object[]
{"John", "Doe"});
resultSet.setupMetaData(resultSetMetaData);

resultSet.addExpectedNamedValues(columnsLowercase,
new Object[] {"John", "Doe"});

Now when my dataaccess code calls
resultSetMetaData.getColumnName(i), resultSet.getObject(i).toString()
the code throws an exception.
Can some one tell me why this happens.
Thankyou
Mona
